official_title: To amend title 10, United States Code, to provide a statutory charter for the operation of the Defense Language Institute and to establish a personnel system for the civilian faculty at that Institute.

summary.text: Defense Language Institute Act of 1990 - Establishes in the Department of Defense (DOD) a school to be known as the Defense Language Institute (Institute) to: (1) provide instruction in foreign languages to military and civilian personnel of DOD and other Government personnel as approved by the Secretary of Defense; and (2) encourage foreign language instruction throughout educational institutions in the United States in order to meet national defense requirements. Provides for a Commandant of the Institute. Requires the Secretary to assign military staff positions at the Institute. Authorizes the employment of civilians as faculty members.
